sub_topic: Identifying the clique number of a graph.
message_1:
What is the clique number of the following graph?

```
    A --------- B
    |\         /|
    |  \     /  |
    |    \ /    |
    |     C     |
    |    / \    |
    |  /     \  |
    |/         \|
    D --------- E
```

If the student needs a definition for clique number: The clique number of a graph is the size of the largest complete subgraph, also known as a clique, in the graph.
message_2:
The clique number of the given graph is 3. 

This can be determined by identifying the largest complete subgraph (clique) in the graph. In this case, the largest clique is formed by the vertices A, C, and D, which are all connected to each other. No other set of 4 or more vertices in the graph are all connected to each other, so the clique number is 3.
